title: Solving Exp and Logs - rewriting expressions

content.question: ​The expression <math alttext="8 to the power of open parentheses x plus 7 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><msup><mn>8</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is part of an equation involving other exponential expressions with base <math alttext="e"><semantics><mi>e</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following is equivalent to <math alttext="8 to the power of open parentheses x plus 7 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><msup><mn>8</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and is therefore more useful in solving the equation?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="e to the power of ln open parentheses x plus 7 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></msup><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="e to the power of open parentheses ln space 2 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 7 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo> </mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></msup><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="e to the power of open parentheses ln space 8 close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses end exponent plus 7"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo> </mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="e to the power of open parentheses ln space 2 close parentheses open parentheses 3 x plus 21 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo> </mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>21</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></msup><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="e to the power of open parentheses ln space 2 close parentheses open parentheses 3 x plus 21 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo> </mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>21</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></msup><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.13: Exponential and Logarithmic Equations and Inequalities

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
